intro: Guichenotia angustifolia, commonly known as narrow-leaf guichenotia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces pods that contain small, rounded seeds. Guichenotia angustifolia is an important plant in ecological studies due to its adaptation to harsh environments.
